value.text: One of Elon Musk's big gripes with Wikipedia is that his entry there has a whole section on his salute during his inauguration speech earlier this year. His Grokipedia entry doesn't mention it at all, but the "Nazi salute" Grokipedia entry says this:

images.alt: On January 20, 2025, during a rally celebrating Donald Trump's second inauguration, Elon Musk extended his right arm twice in a straight-armed gesture while speaking, which multiple observers and media outlets likened to the Nazi salute, igniting debates over intent, free speech limits, and historical symbolism.[78] Musk responded by posting jokes referencing Nazi figures like Rudolf Hess and Joseph Goebbels, dismissing critics and framing accusations as overreactions, while some supporters claimed it evoked a Roman salute adopted by fascists rather than a direct Nazi reference; neo-Nazi accounts online praised the gesture as validation.[79] German officials and historians, citing the gesture's post-1919 fascist codification, condemned it unequivocally, underscoring transatlantic divides in interpreting such acts amid 2024-2025 discussions of ironic or revivalist uses.

record.text: I think about this LeGuin essay a lot. (link in next post; you should read it too.)

images.alt:
Its technology is how a society copes with physical reality: how people get and keep and cook food, how they clothe themselves, what their power sources are (animal? human? water? wind? electricity? other?) what they build with and what they build, their medicine — and so on and on. Perhaps very ethereal people aren’t interested in these mundane, bodily matters, but I’m fascinated by them, and I think most of my readers are too.

Technology is the active human interface with the material world.

But the word is consistently misused to mean only the enormously complex and specialised technologies of the past few decades, supported by massive exploitation both of natural and human resources.

This is not an acceptable use of the word. “Technology” and “hi tech” are not synonymous, and a technology that isn't “hi,” isn’t necessarily '“low” in any meaningful sense.

We have been so desensitized by a hundred and fifty years of ceaselessly expanding technical prowess that we think nothing less complex and showy than a computer or a jet bomber deserves to be called “technology” at all. As if linen were the same thing as flax — as if paper, ink, wheels, knives, clocks, chairs, aspirin pills, were natural objects, born with us like our teeth and fingers — as if steel saucepans with copper bottoms and fleece vests spun from recycled glass grew on trees, and we just picked them when they were ripe...

One way to illustrate that most technologies are, in fact, pretty “hi,” is to ask yourself of any manmade object, Do I know how to make one?

Perhaps very ethereal people aren’t interested in these mundane, bodily matters, but I’m fascinated by them, and I think most of my readers are too.

We have been so desensitized by a hundred and fifty years of ceaselessly expanding technical prowess that we think nothing less complex and showy than a computer or a jet bomber deserves to be called “technology” at all. As if linen were the same thing as flax — as if paper, ink, wheels, knives, clocks, chairs, aspirin pills, were natural objects, born with us like our teeth and fingers — as if steel saucepans with copper bottoms and fleece vests spun from recycled glass grew on trees, and we just picked them when they were ripe...

One way to illustrate that most technologies are, in fact, pretty “hi,” is to ask yourself of any manmade object, Do I know how to make one?

& What's happening: Elon Musk confirmed that X will delete all heuristics from its recommendation system within six weeks. In other words, the familiar logic of likes, replies, and reposts that shaped Twitter for years is about to disappear. In its place, Grok, the platform's in-house Al model, will read and watch more than one hundred million posts
and videos every day to decide what users see. At the same time, X is testing a new interface that keeps users inside the app even when they open external links.

How this hits reality: This marks the first time a major social platform has handed full control of content discovery to an Al model.
Engagement farms, trend-hacking accounts, and traditional growth tactics may soon lose their edge. The new winners will be those who write in ways that Grok interprets as engaging, turning social media optimization into a new form of prompt engineering. This shift could reshape influencer strategies, ad targeting, and even political communication in a matter of weeks.
• Key takeaway: X did not just change its algorithm; it replaced it with an Al reader.
Your reach will soon depend on how fluently you can speak Grok.

I'm trying to come up with a gentle way of saying, "What information in this presentation was copied from ChatGPT? How did you verify it?" without being so gentle about it that the fact that it's probably false information gets overlooked.

Chatbots — LLMs — do not know facts and are not designed to be able to accurately answer factual questions. They are designed to find and mimic patterns of words, probabilistically. When they’re “right” it’s because correct things are often written down, so those patterns are frequent. That’s all.

When a chatbot gets something wrong, it’s not because it made an error. It’s because on that roll of the dice, it happened to string together a group of words that, when read by a human, represents something false. But it was working entirely as designed. It was supposed to make a sentence & it did.

value.text:
🚨BIG changes happening -- ICE leadership is being purged tonight. The old guard, which prioritized targeted enforcement operations aimed at people with criminal records, is being replaced with Border Patrol and Gregory Bovino's "Midway Blitz" style.

Think things are bad now? It'll get worse.

images.alt:
Bill Melugin
@BillMelugin_
BREAKING: Per four senior DHS & Trump admin sources, a mass removal of ICE leadership around the country is underway, with up to 12 ICE field office chiefs being removed & reassigned in an effort to increase deportation numbers. I'm told the move is spearheaded by Corey Lewandowski, and a handful of the ICE Chiefs will likely be replaced by Border Patrol & CBP officials, some of whom will be hand-picked by aggressive & controversial Border Patrol Commander Greg Bovino. I'm told some of the ICE leadership removed from their positions include the ICE Field Office Directors in:

- Los Angeles
- Phoenix
- Philadelphia
- Denver
- El Paso
- San Diego
- Seattle/Portland
- New Orleans

Border Patrol officials taking over ICE leadership positions would be extremely significant, as Border Patrol and ICE do different things, and I've done numerous ride-alongs/embeds with both.

Generally speaking, ICE typically conducts very targeted operations, largely going after criminal illegal aliens or those with deportation orders, but almost always knowing who they are targeting for arrest, often conducting surveillance to learn their schedules before and waiting hours before arresting them if needed.

Border Patrol, under Trump 2.0, while sometimes doing their own targeted operations, has been extremely aggressive and has been at the forefront of some of the most controversial immigration enforcement operations we've seen so far, carrying out roving patrols in Los Angeles, Chicago, etc, often at Home Depot, car washes, flea markets etc, leading to a handful of federal judges around the country issuing injunctions against them. A majority of the viral videos you see online are Border Patrol agents, including the use of a Trojan horse style Penske moving truck at a Los Angeles Home Depot, an operation organized by Bovino. 

ICE often gets blamed for what Border Patrol does, as the media and activists often cannot tell the difference between federal agents, and everyone is called "ICE". I'm told there are growing concerns about the political and PR fallout associated with some of the roving patrols Border Patrol is conducting as lawsuits continue to stack up and mid-terms approach next year.

I'm told there is significant friction within different wings of DHS and the administration, with Border Czar Tom Homan & ICE Director Todd Lyons preferring to prioritize targeting criminal aliens & the "worst of the worst" or those with deportation orders, while DHS Secretary Kristi Noem, Corey Lewandowski, and BP Commander Bovino prefer to use aggressive tactics to arrest anyone in the US illegally, including but not limited to criminals, to ramp up deportation numbers and achieve President Trump's promises of mass deportations. 

I am hearing from both sides of this friction.

One senior DHS official tells me:

"ICE started with the worst of the worst, knowing every target they are hitting, but since Border Patrol started in LA in June, we've (DHS) lost our focus, going too hard, too fast, with limited prioritization. It's getting numbers, but at what cost?".

Border Patrol agents I've talked to defend their tactics, with one telling me:

"What did everyone think mass deportations meant? Only the worst? Tom Homan has said it himself, anyone in the US illegally is on the table."

It's quite a situation, as both sides of this are on the same team, with the same end goals, but different perspectives on how to get there. 

Another DHS official confirmed the personnel changes to me on deep background, adding that the moves are based on performance and doing what is needed to achieve the best results. 

Official statement to 
@FoxNews
 via 
@TriciaOhio
:

"While we have no personnel changes to announce at this time, the Trump Administration remains laser focused on delivering results and removing violent criminal illegal aliens from this country."
7:57 PM · Oct 27, 2025
·
29.6K
 Views

「AIはニュートンになれない」：日本経済新聞 www.nikkei.com/article/DGKK... 
「統計的な推論と論理的な推論ができる賢い機械は今後5～10年で開発される。ただ、突拍子もない発想をするAIは、ここ20年間はできないとみている。飛躍的な発想をするAIを開発するには、人間の発想の仕組みを明らかにする研究が重要だ」
⇒ 全く異なる概念や言語でまとめられていても、ただ単に発音が似ているなどで、無理やり発想、連想を広げることができる。言わばセンスの良い乱数でしかない。はて、そう言えば素数って…。

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "Is Anyone In Control? ALIEN Hand Syndrome: The Hand That Has a Mind of Its Own" on @Spreaker #alienhandsyndrome #brain #braindisorder #cognitivescience #corpuscallosum #drstrangelove #humanbrain #involuntarymovement #medicalmysteries #mindblown #mindofitsown #neurology #podcast

external.description:
Imagine waking up one day and your own hand is no longer yours. It moves, it grasps, it fights with your other hand... and you are not in control. This isn't a horror movie—it's a real neurological disorder.

Welcome to the baffling and terrifying world of Alien Hand Syndrome (AHS), the rare neurological disorder where a person's limb truly seems to have a mind of its own. Join us as we explore one of the most bizarre medical mysteries ever documented, separating fact from fiction. We'll uncover how damage to the brain, specifically the corpus callosum that connects the two hemispheres, can cause this shocking disconnect between intention and action.

Discover the science behind the symptoms, from "intermanual conflict"—where your hands literally fight each other—to involuntary grasping of objects. We'll investigate the causes, from stroke and neurodegenerative diseases to the aftermath of radical brain surgery. This journey into the depths of neuroscience and psychology will challenge everything you thought you knew about control, consciousness, and what it truly means to be "you." We'll also discuss how patients cope and the therapies used to manage a life with a rogue limb.

Ready to question who's really in charge? If you're fascinated by the hidden workings of the human brain, hit that subscribe button now. Share this episode with anyone who loves a good mind-bending story, and join our community as we explore the edge of medical science. You'll never look at your own hands the same way again.
external.title: Is Anyone In Control? ALIEN Hand Syndrome: The Hand That Has a Mind of Its Own

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "Your BRAIN on Drugs: The UNFILTERED Guide" on @Spreaker #addiction #addictionrecovery #brainchemistry #depressants #dopamine #drugeducation #hallucinogens #health #howdrugswork #knowyoursubstance #mentalhealth #neuroscience #pharmacology #podcast #psychoactive #psychology

external.description:
You think you're in control. That coffee just helps you focus. That drink just helps you relax. But what if that's just the story the chemicals want you to believe?

Welcome to the official user's manual for your brain on drugs. This isn't a lecture or a scare tactic; it's a brutally honest tour of our own brain chemistry and the psychoactive substances we use to alter it. We're pulling back the curtain on everything from the stimulants that kickstart your day, like caffeine and nicotine, to the depressants like alcohol that help you unwind.

Each episode, we break down the raw neuroscience of a specific drug—how stimulants like cocaine hijack your dopamine system, how opioids create a dangerous euphoria, and how hallucinogens rewrite your reality. We map out the entire user experience: the first euphoric rush, the peak, and the brutal, inevitable comedown. We expose the illusion of control and reveal the mechanics of chemical dependency and the harsh reality of withdrawal symptoms.

This is the drug education you never got in school, exploring the science behind the high and the biological trap of addiction.

If you're ready to understand the chemicals that shape our world and our minds, subscribe now. Knowledge is the ultimate power.
external.title: Your BRAIN on Drugs: The UNFILTERED Guide

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "MACROHARD: Inside Elon Musk's NO-HUMAN AI Company" on @Spreaker #ai #aiagents #airevolution #artificialintelligence #automation #colossus #datacenter #elonmusk #futureofwork #grok #innovation #macrohard #microsoft #podcast #softwaredevelopment #startup #tech #techgiants #xai

external.description:
Elon Musk is building a multi-billion dollar tech giant with a workforce of zero. This isn't science fiction; it's his audacious new venture, and he's not-so-subtly calling it "Macrohard."

Welcome to the inside story of the most disruptive startup of the decade. Elon Musk is launching Macrohard, a new AI company designed to take on Microsoft and other tech giants without hiring a single human developer. How? By building a corporation run entirely by AI agents. We'll take you inside the plans for "Colossus 2," a massive, 1 million square-foot data center in Memphis being built at impossible speed to house the AI's rapidly evolving mind.

This podcast unpacks the ultimate troll in tech history and the profound implications for the future of work. We'll explore the irony of Microsoft indirectly helping Musk's other venture, xAI, while he openly mocks them. Is this just a rivalry, or is it the first step towards a fully autonomous company that can write its own software, manage its own projects, and change the world?

From the name on the roof visible from space to the goal of creating an exponentially improving intelligence, Macrohard is Musk's next "impossible" project. This is the definitive guide to the company that could either be a work of genius or a spectacular failure.

The AI revolution is here, and it's building its own headquarters. Subscribe now to follow the story of Macrohard from day one and witness the future being built.
external.title: MACROHARD: Inside Elon Musk's NO-HUMAN AI Company

people are paid so fucking little that despite full-time jobs they need help to EAT. It isn't even a matter of getting a job or more money, there's literally nothing anyone can do because you can't work more hours than there are in a day

I hope this inspires a general strike.

10月28日（火）〈晴〉、Blueskyのみなさんおはようございます

今朝起きた時点の体調は中の中の下！

今日は「おだしの日」です、和食の要である「おだし」の一つ「かつお節」の燻（いぶ）して魚の中の水分を除去し、良質なかつお節カビを付着させることで、悪カビの発生を防ぐという「燻乾（ばいかん）カビ付け製法」を考案した江戸時代の紀州印南浦の漁民・角屋甚太郎氏の命日である1707年10月28日から

今日は日本シリーズ第３戦、１勝１敗です、阪神はきついでしょう、ソフトバンクはなにせラスボスチートキャラモイネロ先発

本日もよろしくお願いします
今日の女子力：30%

value.text:
10月27日（月）〈晴〉、Blueskyのみなさんおはようございます

今日起きた時点の体調はゲッゲッゲゲゲのゲ〜〜！
今日の午後から青空は通常運転になります

みなさんは日頃、読書をされていますか？
今日は「読書の日」＆「文字・活字文化の日」で今日から「読書週間」（10月27日～11月9日）になります

「読書の日」は読書週間の一日目の日にあたることから、書籍にも記念日として記されているものの詳細は不明、「読書週間」は1924年に図書館の利用PRを目的に制定した「図書館週間」（11月17日～23日）が母体になる

本日もよろしくお願いします
今日の女子力：-∞%

value.text:
10月26日（日）〈雨〉、Blueskyのみなさんおはようございます

今日起きた時点の体調はゲゲゲのゲ！
昨日もご挨拶に伺えませんでした、明日から青空は通常運転になる予定です

今日は「原子力の日」（1964年7月31日に日本で初の原子力発電が行われ、国連の専門機関の一つである国際原子力機関（IAEA）に加盟、そのことにより閣議決定によって制定）であると共に「反原子力デー」で全国各地で原発反対運動が起きる、エネルギー供給は大事だがその方法と理解を求めるのには問題も多い、だが資源がない実情を考えるとそうも言えない

本日もよろしくお願いします

chotiner is just socrates in every single socratic dialogue, where he's just like, "hmmm and what do you MEAN by that?" relentlessly until the idiot starts crying and runs away

value.text: Chotiner operates on an elementary but effective cut-and-thrust. He is conversational enough to settle an idiot down, and they're all idiots these days. Then he's always prepared with a follow-up. But he pulls his punch. He lets the subject lean into it so far they fall over.
I actually don't think Chotiner is preternaturally good at interviewing or whatever, I just think the rest of the national press is operating at goo goo ga ga level

But it will help you activate a JDK globally and locally, by using Maven/Gradle features. github.com/brunoborges/...

record.text:
Me: Uninstalls Copilot from Windows 11.

Windows: "Warning. Should this program be removed, certain other programs could stop working as intended."

Me: "Good."

Bored on Bluesky?
You should follow more people then. Always something new and interesting to see on the timeline for me.

I’d say you’re sitting at around two or three, yeah.
You’re generally pretty easy to talk to, just by looking at the replies you send to others, and I don’t ever feel particularly hesitant about leaving comments on your posts ^^

I am, sadly, resigning myself to the impossibility of ever being able to delete CoPilot from my laptop. Tried everything. Nothing works. It's still there, popping up uninvited on every keystroke, prompting me to let it rewrite everything I've created. Very soon, I'll go back to writing longhand 🖊

DHL receiver auth:
👍 guy at the shop quickly glancing at your ID card.
👎BankID trying to parse "/ROPERT/MATHIEU/" when it says "ROPERT, MATHIEU" in the system.
We have to validate all of the output, but that is easier than filling in the tables ourselves, since most of the extraction was correct.

We gave it a blank table with column and row names and a paper or link to the registry and had it fill the table in. In one case, the paper was a simulation, not an RCT/TTE so Claude changed the table to fit a simulation study and extracted related elements.

A PhD student and I are currently finishing up an analysis in which we had Claude 3.7 extract elements of RCTs and matching TTEs from papers and the clinical trial registry. Claude was nearly perfect except for some edge conditions and confusion over dates. It was zero shot learning.
